org.forgerock.openidm.repo.orientdb.impl

Class OrientDBRepoService

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.forgerock.openidm.repo.orientdb.impl.OrientDBRepoService
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.forgerock.json.resource.RequestHandler, org.forgerock.openidm.repo.RepoBootService, org.forgerock.openidm.repo.RepositoryService

    @Service(value={org.forgerock.openidm.repo.RepositoryService.class,org.forgerock.json.resource.RequestHandler.class})
@Properties(value={@Property(name="service.description",value="Repository Service using OrientDB"),@Property(name="service.vendor",value="ForgeRock AS."),@Property(name="openidm.router.prefix",value="/repo/*")})
public class OrientDBRepoService
extends Object
implements org.forgerock.json.resource.RequestHandler, org.forgerock.openidm.repo.RepositoryService, org.forgerock.openidm.repo.RepoBootService
    Repository service implementation using OrientDB

      • handleRead2

        public void handleRead2(org.forgerock.json.resource.ServerContext context,
               org.forgerock.json.resource.ReadRequest request,
               org.forgerock.json.resource.ResultHandler<org.forgerock.json.resource.Resource> handler)
                 throws org.forgerock.json.resource.ResourceException

        The object will contain metadata properties, including object identifier _id, and object version _rev to enable optimistic concurrency supported by OrientDB and OpenIDM.

        Parameters:
        request - the identifier of the object to retrieve from the object set.
        Throws:
        org.forgerock.json.resource.NotFoundException - if the specified object could not be found.
        org.forgerock.json.resource.ForbiddenException - if access to the object is forbidden.
        org.forgerock.json.resource.BadRequestException - if the passed identifier is invalid
        org.forgerock.json.resource.ResourceException

      • handleCreate2

        public void handleCreate2(org.forgerock.json.resource.ServerContext context,
                 org.forgerock.json.resource.CreateRequest request,
                 org.forgerock.json.resource.ResultHandler<org.forgerock.json.resource.Resource> handler)
                   throws org.forgerock.json.resource.ResourceException
        Creates a new object in the object set.

        This method sets the _id property to the assigned identifier for the object, and the _rev property to the revised object version (For optimistic concurrency)

        Parameters:
        context - the client-generated identifier to use, or null if server-generated identifier is requested.
        request - the contents of the object to create in the object set.
        Throws:
        org.forgerock.json.resource.NotFoundException - if the specified id could not be resolved.
        org.forgerock.json.resource.ForbiddenException - if access to the object or object set is forbidden.
        org.forgerock.json.resource.ConflictException - if an object with the same ID already exists.
        org.forgerock.json.resource.ResourceException

      • handleUpdate2

        public void handleUpdate2(org.forgerock.json.resource.ServerContext context,
                 org.forgerock.json.resource.UpdateRequest request,
                 org.forgerock.json.resource.ResultHandler<org.forgerock.json.resource.Resource> handler)
                   throws org.forgerock.json.resource.ResourceException
        Updates the specified object in the object set.

        This implementation does not require MVCC and uses the current revision if no revision is specified in the request.

        If successful, this method updates metadata properties within the passed object, including: a new _rev value for the revised object's version

        Parameters:
        fullId - the identifier of the object to be put, or null to request a generated identifier.
        rev - the version of the object to update; or null if not provided.
        obj - the contents of the object to put in the object set.
        Throws:
        org.forgerock.json.resource.ConflictException - if version is required but is null.
        org.forgerock.json.resource.ForbiddenException - if access to the object is forbidden.
        org.forgerock.json.resource.NotFoundException - if the specified object could not be found.
        org.forgerock.json.resource.PreconditionFailedException - if version did not match the existing object in the set.
        org.forgerock.json.resource.BadRequestException - if the passed identifier is invalid
        org.forgerock.json.resource.ResourceException

      • handleQuery2

        public void handleQuery2(org.forgerock.json.resource.ServerContext context,
                org.forgerock.json.resource.QueryRequest request,
                org.forgerock.json.resource.QueryResultHandler handler)
                  throws org.forgerock.json.resource.ResourceException
        Performs the query on the specified object and returns the associated results.

        Queries are parametric; a set of named parameters is provided as the query criteria. The query result is a JSON object structure composed of basic Java types. The returned map is structured as follow: - The top level map contains meta-data about the query, plus an entry with the actual result records. - The QueryConstants defines the map keys, including the result records (QUERY_RESULT)

        Parameters:
        context - identifies the object to query.
        request - the parameters of the query to perform.
        Throws:
        org.forgerock.json.resource.NotFoundException - if the specified object could not be found.
        org.forgerock.json.resource.BadRequestException - if the specified params contain invalid arguments, e.g. a query id that is not configured, a query expression that is invalid, or missing query substitution tokens.
        org.forgerock.json.resource.ForbiddenException - if access to the object or specified query is forbidden.
        org.forgerock.json.resource.ResourceException

      • query

        public List<org.forgerock.json.resource.Resource> query(org.forgerock.json.resource.QueryRequest request)
                                                 throws org.forgerock.json.resource.ResourceException

      • adapt

        public org.forgerock.json.resource.ResourceException adapt(Throwable t)
        Adapts a Throwable to a ResourceException. If the Throwable is an JSON JsonValueException then an appropriate ResourceException is returned, otherwise an InternalServerErrorException is returned.
        Parameters:
        t - The Throwable to be converted.
        Returns:
        The equivalent resource exception.
